summary: Reddit sued Anthropic, alleging the Claude chatbot developer unlawfully trained models on Reddit users’ personal data without a license . The social media platform has content licensing deals with Google and OpenAI . The complaint, filed in California Wednesday, accuses Anthropic of scraping Reddit’s servers more than 100,000 times .  Reddit’s user agreement includes certain privacy measures, including requiring companies to remove users’ deleted posts from their training systems . Anthropic spokesperson toldInvestopedia, “We disagree with Reddit's claims and will defend ourselves vigorously"

Reddit says it has used the social media company’s content without permission to train its AI models . The lawsuit alleges that Anthropic attempted to access Reddit data more than 100,000 times since last July . Anthropic says it disagrees with Reddit's claims and will “defend ourselves vigorously”  The AI startup Anthropic “bills itself as the white knight of the AI industry,” Reddit said in the lawsuit . The social media platform called Anthropic’s emphasis on trust and honesty “empty marketing gimmicks”  This suit is among a flurry of high-profile complaints against AI companies including Meta Platforms Inc. and OpenAI . Reddit would prefer to reach an agreement outside of court, Lee said .  Trump Considers Deporting Migrants to Rwanda after the UK Decides Not to . Trump considers deporting Migrants from the UK to Rwanda, but UK decides not to .

Google signs agreement to deploy a 14,800-kilometer (9,196-mile) submarine data cable across the Pacific Ocean to connect with Australia and Asia . The pact aims to bolster Chile's digital connectivity with Asian nations, including China . The initiative coincides with Chile's ambitions to become a regional hub for Latin America .  The cable will connect Valparaiso in Chile's central region to Australia . Authorities suggested the cable could enhance the performance of Asian platforms like TikTok . It could also support mining operations in both Chile and Australia .  Partners aim to identify an operator to commercialize the cable's capacity . Chile's state Desarrollo Pais is also looking into linking the cable to Argentina via a border crossing . Separately, Chile is planning a submarine cable to link the southern tip of South America with Antarctica .

Apple will host its annual developers conference on June 9 at its headquarters in Cupertino, Calif., giving us a glimpse at the software updates it has planned for the year ahead . Wall Street investors and analysts will be far more interested in how Apple is working to better compete in the AI space .  Siri is supposed to be able to tap into your personal information and preferences to provide helpful responses to a wide range of queries . The most famous example Apple cited was asking Siri when someone's flight would land at the airport . Apple kicked off its AI push at WWDC 2024, revealing its Writing Tools and Genmoji features .  Apple is "digging itself out of a hole," analyst Patrick Moorhead says . It will need to show developers that it's giving them the tools necessary to develop AI apps for its platforms . "They got caught flat-footed with generative AI," analyst says .  Apple Intelligence is only available for the iPhone 15 Pro, the iPhone 16 line, and various iPads and Macs . Apple said the software is too resource-intensive for older iPhones to handle . The move could help software makers design new, exciting offerings that eventually drive sales .  OpenAI and Jony Ive's upcoming AI-based consumer product could be a formidable threat to Apple . The inclusion of Ive, who helped lead Apple's design team for years and ushered in the age of the iPhone, means OpenAI's offering could prove to be formidable threat .

Spending on AI-powered search advertising is poised to surge to nearly $26 billion by 2029 from just over $1 billion this year in the U.S. Companies that rely on traditional keyword-based search ads could experience revenue declines due to growing popularity of AI search ads .  AI-powered search results could upend business models of some companies . Online education firm Chegg said in May that it would lay off about 248 employees . Financial services, technology, telecom, and healthcare are embracing AI as they are seeing clear advantages in using the technology .  Google recently announced the expansion of its AI-powered search capabilities into the consumer packaged goods sector through enhancements in Google Shopping . The report said the growth of AI search capabilities in the U.S. is slow .

AppLovin has emerged as a dominant force in the mobile advertising ecosystem . The company's AI engine, Axon 2, has significantly transformed the company’s ad platform . Ad spend for gaming clients has quadrupled .  Axon 2 has reshaped the economics of mobile game discovery and monetization . Applovintakes a different route, using AI to drive direct monetization in mobile advertising .  APP trades at a forward price-to-earnings ratio of 40.31, well above the industry’s 24.17 . Needham downgrades Apple to Hold from Buy by Needham analysts . Analyst Laura Martin said the stock is overvalued amid growing AI competition . Apple is currently the worst-performing stock of its Big Tech peers, down 18% for the year .  Needham's downgrade comes as the smartphone market at large is experiencing a slump . Counterpoint Research on Wednesday lowered its 2025 annual growth forecast for global smartphone shipments to 1.9% from 4.2% . Meanwhile, Apple is facing growing competition in AI .  In April, Apple stock's 200-day moving average rose above its 50-day average, a phenomenon called a "death cross" The company still lacks a competitive LLM [large language model] or a developer ecosystem around GenAI capabilities, Martin wrote .  The company's culture may not help as it grapples with myriad challenges . Martin: "AAPL believes that it makes its own weather. This philosophy reflects a deep-seated cultural belief that AAPL operates on its own terms"

Alphabet's GOOGL shares have mirrored the broader market's volatility in 2025 . The tech giant’s shares carried that momentum into early 2025, rising another 8.9% . Google lost a landmark antitrust case brought by the U.S. Department of Justice in August 2024 .  The U.S. DOJ has proposed that Google be required to sell its Chrome browser and share search data with competitors . Judge Mehta expected to issue a ruling by August . The most likely buyers of Chrome can be well-capitalized AI companies such as OpenAI, Anthropic or perhaps Perplexity .  IShares Global Comm Services ETF has an exposure of 11.97% in GOOGL. Google is delaying the rollout of its "Ask Photos" feature for about two weeks . The product isn't up to par when it comes to latency, quality, and user experience, Google Photos product manager Jamie Aspinall said . Ask Photos allows users to search their Google Photos libraries using natural language prompts . Google did not respond to a request for comment before publication .
Alphabet's Google unit said Wednesday that its threat intelligence group is tracking a threat . Alphabet's (GOOG, GOOGL) Google unit is tracking the threat of a terrorist act .

JPMorgan unveiled a slate of top internet stocks, including Amazon, Meta, and Alphabet . Others to earn a shoutout included Spotify, eBay, Etsy, Duolingo, and Booking . The bank raised its price targets for companies across the sector as trade war concerns have abated in recent weeks .  Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp parent could deliver revenue growth in the low teens in 2025 and 2026, JPMorgan says . The company moved its price target to $240 from $225, which implies 17% upside over Amazon's price . Google owner Alphabet was also listed among JPMorgan's top internet picks .  The music streaming giant is expected to see low-mid teens revenue growth driven by its premium subscriber base . eBay and Etsy should each benefit from China tariff relief, JPMorgan said .

The rapid development of data centers connected to the largest US electric grid raised costs by $9.4 billion . Consumers from Illinois to Washington, D.C., will see reflected in their utility bills starting this month . Overall costs rose by 180%, with the growing energy needs being the primary cause of tight supply-and-demand conditions .  The cost for procuring supplies on the eastern US grid jumped to a record $14.7 billion . The cost would have otherwise been closer to $5 billion when accounting for existing and forecast demand . The biggest increases were in Virginia and Maryland .  Data center boom is driving power demand on the grid toward levels not seen in 20 years . PJM said summer peak power consumption may climb by 70 gigawatts to 220 gigawatts over the next 15 years . That would be 32% higher than the all-time high of about 165.6 gigawatts reached in summer of 2006 .  Brian George, who leads global energy market development and policy at Google, said on a panel . “We are now imposing a significant cost on the system," he said .

Apple (AAPL) planning to use technology from theAIstartup Perplexity as an alternative to Google (GOOGL) search on the iPhone and to replace the option of integrating ChatGPT in Siri . “We’ve started some discussions with them about what they’re doing,” Eddy Cue, Apple’s senior vice president of services said during testimony at a Google antitrust trial .  Revenue grew 13% in May, says Evercore ISI . Apple files appeal over EU order on iOS interoperability, WSJ reports . ‘Keep an Eye on the App Store,’ says Goldman Sachs about Apple stock .

Salesforce's agreement to buy Informatica Inc. for $8 billion came a year after initial talks collapsed . The software giant lowered the price it was willing to accept for a deal . The result is evidence of Salesforce’s more-disciplined approach to dealmaking .  Salesforce sealed a purchase on May 27 for Informatica at $25 a share . The deal marks the company's return to making big deals after years of skepticism from investors .  Salesforce CEO John Somorjai and his advisers at JPMorgan Chase & Co. reached out to Informatica’s board with an interest in rekindling their courtship . A deal would likely come at a significant discount to the $10 billion price tag being discussed a year earlier . “Project Inspire” was the code name for the potential deal .  Sale process was accelerating at pace by the end of April and remained competitive until roughly 24 hours before Salesforce had a handshake agreement with Informatica . Benioff: “We were lucky to be the winning bid. a reference to the sacred mountain in the Himalayas that’s revered as the home of Lord Shiva .  Investors, including Starboard Value LP, Elliott Management Corp., ValueAct Capital Management LLC and Third Point LLC, criticized Salesforce’s slowing revenue growth and M&A record . Salesforce responded by cutting about 10% of its workforce, setting an aggressive profit goal .  Salesforce’s stock slid more than 7% in the following trading session, wiping roughly $20 billion in value from its market capitalization . The two companies had already agreed to contracts, a price was all but finalized and a date for the public reveal was just a few days away .  Salesforce chief operating and financial officer Robin Washington said the recent deal was as much about getting “our arms around the valuation” as it was the timing . “We were patient, we were disciplined, and felt that now was the right time to put the marriage together," she said .  “AI cannot come to fruition without the foundation of good data,” Informatica’s Walia said in a Bloomberg Television interview . Alphabet meets many of Warren Buffett's investment requirements . Alphabet faces some headwinds that could be difficult to overcome, but not impossible . Buffett is a value investor at heart, and he likes businesses that generate a ton of cash flow .  Alphabet's brand value can't be disputed, as its properties like Google, YouTube, and the Android operating system are at the top of their respective industries . It's also a free-cash-flow-generating machine, turning 21% of revenue into free cash flow over the past 12 months . At 19 times trailing earnings and 18 times forward earnings, Alphabet's stock is at some of the cheapest levels it has reached in some time .  Alphabet's stock looks quite inexpensive compared to the broader market (as measured by theS&P 500) Google Search is trying to defend its market share from generative AI products . Google already offers AI search overviews, bridging the gap between traditional search and a full AI experience .  Investors are worried about Alphabet's advertising business during an economic downturn . About three-quarters of Alphabet's revenue comes from ad revenue, so it's a very important market . The economic uncertainty caused by tariffs could trigger a downturn or a recession, hurting Alphabet's ad market .  Alphabet will likely be intact five years from now. due to the AI headwinds it's already facing . Buffett might be thinking the same thing, and you never know if he wants to make one more splash in the investment world before he retires . Meta Platforms is generating strong growth as its AI capabilities boost advertising revenue . The company delivered an impressive Q1, helping to brush aside market concerns about a shifting economy . The stock's several advantages relative to its "Magnificent Seven" peers may help it outperform in the second half of 2025 .  Meta Platforms distinguishes itself through pioneering innovation in social media, with over 3.4 billion monthly active users across its ecosystem, including Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp . Unlike hyperscalers likeMicrosoftandAmazon, whose AI strategies depend on selling cloud-based AI services to external clients, Meta's strength lies in directly applying its AI models to enhance its core advertising business .  In the first quarter of 2025, revenue rose 16% year over year . Net income soared 35% to a record $16.6 billion, or $6.43 in earnings per share . Despite higher AI investment, Meta generated $10.3 billion in free cash flow . Wall Street analysts anticipate 14% revenue growth for 2025 and 2026 .  Meta Platforms stands out as a top AI stock because of its attractive valuation . With a forward price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 25, Meta trades at a large discount to its Magnificent Seven peers .  Meta Platforms stock is a great option for investors seeking to build a diversified portfolio with exposure to high-level themes in technology and AI . While internet giantAlphabetis the exception, trading at a forward P/E of 18, it faces significant regulatory scrutiny . AIG said its agentic AI ecosystem with Palantir, Anthropic, and AWS can accelerate the underwriting process up to 5X. and increase productivity not by percentages, but by multiples . Walgreens deployed AI-powered workflows to 4,000 stores in just eight months .  Palantir’s AIP uniquely powers core operational decisions in ways Salesforce, Microsoft and Google have yet to match . The stock has surged a whopping 76% year to date, outperforming the industry's 10% rally . PLTR trades at a forward price-to-sales ratio of 71.64 . An AI stock that's skyrocketed by almost 2,000% since the start of 2023 is making history for all the wrong reasons . Meanwhile, another industry-leading AI stock with a cash cow of a foundational operating segment stands out as a clear bargain in a pricey market .  Analysts at PwC estimated a $15.7 trillion global addressable market for AI by the turn of the decade . Since the end of 2022, shares of Palantir Technologies have skyrocketed by almost 2,000%!  Palantir Technologies is recurringly profitable . It began generating recurring profits well ahead of Wall Street's expectations . The company has no one-for-one, large-scale replacements .  Palantir Technologies' Gotham's prospective pool of clients is limited . Considering that only the U.S. and its allies can access its AI-powered platform, long-term sales growth rate should taper . History and next-big-thing trends rarely mix well .  Palantir closed out the month of May with a trailing-12-month (TTM) price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 105 . No megacap stock on the leading edge of a next-big-thing trend has ever been able to sustain a P/S ratio of 30 to 40 .  In 2025, Alphabet stock has been weighed down by two potential issues . First, there's the legal uncertainty tied to the U.S. Justice Department's recommendation that Alphabet be broken up . The other concern weighing on Alphabet's shares this year is the prospect of large language model (LLM) chatbots siphoning away its search market share .  Even with the emergence of a handful of popular LLMs, Google has accounted for between an 89% and 93% share of worldwide internet search . Businesses view Google as the premier avenue to target users with their message(s) Google Cloud is the world's No. 3 cloud infrastructure service platform by spending .  Alphabet closed out the first quarter with more than $95 billion in combined cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities . Google Cloud is generating roughly $49 billion in sales on an annual run-rate basis . The company's forward price-to-earnings ratio of 16.9 marks a 24% discount to its average forward P/E multiple over the trailing five-year period .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is987% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to171% for the S&P 500 . Alphabet and Meta Platforms trade at very attractive valuations, especially when you consider their fundamental strengths . Alphabet revealed 100 new announcements, most of them related to artificial intelligence (AI) at its annual Google I/O developer conference . According to Mark Zuckerberg, Meta AI has now amassed 1 billion monthly active users .  Alphabet has had AI at the forefront of its strategy for about a decade . It continues to release new versions of itsGemini large language models . At its recent I/O developer conference, the company introduced numerous new AI-related features across the business .  Mark Zuckerberg's Meta AI assistant has now reached 1 billion monthly active users . With 3.43 billion daily active users, Meta is in the same ballpark as Alphabet in terms of a massive user base . As of March 31, it had $95 billion of cash, cash, equivalents, and marketable securities .  Meta had $70 billion in cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities on the books at the end of Q1 . It generated $17 billion in net income during the quarter . Management plans to spend $68 billion (at the midpoint) this year to bolster its tech infrastructure .  These two companies are the cheapest of the "Magnificent Seven" grouping . In my opinion, investors don't need to pick just one of these dominant businesses . I see no reason why both of these AI stocks can't be bought today .  Meta Platforms CEO Mark Zuckerberg's sister Randi Zuckerberg is a former Facebook spokeswoman .
